result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorsey L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $250  + costs =$768 plus $50 drug testing fee. All fines and costs are to be paid TODAY 6/30/15
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay court costs totalling, $443. All fines and costs are to be paid TODAY 6/30/15

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dorsey L Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with elements/JI's and criminal case settlement

[MK] case called at 10:28am. 
Defendant Dorsey L Brown in court with Attorney Robert F Nagel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Nagel requests a brief recess for the Defense to complete paperwork for entry of a change in plea.
recess 10:29am, reconvene 10:56am. 
Clerk MO

ADA Shock orally motions to amend Count #1 to Misdemeanor possession of THC
--The Court grants motion to amend Count #1

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Amended Count #1 and Count #2 as charged; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Amended Count #1: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $250  + costs =$768 plus $50 drug testing fee
On Count #2: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay court costs totalling, $443

All fines and costs totalling $1261 are to be paid TODAY 6/30/15
recess: 11:20am
Status conference on June 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 2:17pm. 
Defendant Dorsey L Brown in court with Attorney Robert F Nagel.  ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Brown verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the felony charge and maximum penalties are recited. The reading of the Count #2 charge and the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with RIcky Reich except for contact only at work at Maxcor and as required by his employment 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--no presence at the Super 8 Motel in the City of Watertown  
recess 2:31pm. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/20/15 at 11:00am   (2) Status Conference on 6/30/15 at 10:30am (Case is at Prelim stage, Co-Defendant's case is in warrant status as of this date)
Initial appearance on May 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Request to adjourn initial appearance submitted by the State
